main_characters.name: Mukundan Unni
descriptions: 27-year-old lawyer, wearing a white shirt, white pants, glasses, and carrying a laptop bag.
Lawyer, arriving at the MLA's house.
Lawyer, observing the situation.
Lawyer, taking instructions.
Lawyer, trying to get involved in the case.
Lawyer, persistent in his efforts to join the case.
Lawyer, parking his bike.
Lawyer, entering the office.
Lawyer, facing his senior.
Lawyer, drenched in rain, entering the shop.
Lawyer, watching his name being engraved.
Lawyer, riding his bike in the rain.
Lawyer, studying a case file seriously.
Lawyer, walking with Robin and then sitting with Jyothi.
Lawyer, performing his morning routine with discipline, reacting to news and a domestic emergency.
Lawyer, waiting at the hospital, concerned about payment.
Lawyer, waiting in the ATM queue.
Lawyer, withdrawing all available money.
Lawyer, attempting to pay with insufficient funds.
27-year-old, wearing a white shirt and white pants, glasses, carrying a laptop bag. Appears observant, looking at an expensive car.
Arrives at the MLA's house on a bike, sends a message on WhatsApp.
Observes the scene, attempts to initiate a conversation with George, stands in the background.
Takes his bike, then deliberately turns it off after seeing the MLA's car leave. Appears thoughtful.
Enters the room, confidently pitches his strategy to George, emphasizing his personal stake in the case.
Walks alongside George, detailing his plan to prove a fake order, introduces himself as Mukundan Unni, gets a negative reaction from George and Chaakkappan.
Parks his bike in the parking area.
Enters the office.
Enters Gangadharan's room, shows documents, denies giving advice, then confronts Gangadharan, is fired, and defiantly responds.
Enters a shop, partially wet from the rain, writes his name and designation on paper.
Riding his bike, wet from the rain, climbing the Wayanad churam (hairpin bends).
Seriously examining a case file, attempts to secure a new client, but is rejected.
Walks with Robin, sits with Jyothi, observes Robin's situation, and engages in a cynical discussion about legal practice with Jyothi.
Follows a disciplined morning routine: wakes at 5 AM, exercises, washes/irons clothes, tidies his room, watches news, eats breakfast, reacts calmly to a snake, and secures the outhouse.
Sits in the waiting area, then approaches the cashier, expresses surprise and concern about the high advance payment for his mother's operation.
Stands in the ATM queue, listening to Robin.
Withdraws all his available balance (7500 INR) from the ATM.
Presents 7500 INR to the hospital staff, suggesting it for the payment.

main_characters.name: Mani
descriptions: Pays large sums of cash, observed by Unni, later revealed as an agent.
Walking, asking for room directions.
Arranging for a patient to sign documents.
Buys tea after paying a bill, looks surprised by Unni's interaction.
Gets Unni's mother to sign a document.
Paying a bill, making a call to Venu Vakkeel.
Enters doctor's room with Unni, hands over phone to doctor.
Shows Unni a photo of the car and gives instructions.
Present during the scene mahasar, having instructed Unni to file a complaint.
Reminds the doctor about the 'ookku' (force) to be added to the report.
Explains the process of claim payout and distribution to Unni and Robin.
An agent handling cash transactions for various individuals.
Continuing to pay large sums of cash.
Exiting the billing section after collecting receipts.
An agent, inquiring about patient details.
An agent, getting a document signed by a patient.
An agent, paying a bill and ordering tea.
An agent, getting Vakkaalath signed by Unni's mother.
An agent, calling the advocate.
An agent, convincing the doctor to alter medical reports.
An agent, providing Unni with details of the accident vehicle and further instructions.
N/A
An agent, influencing the doctor to add specific details to the wound certificate.
An agent, explaining the claim distribution process.

main_characters.name: Unni
descriptions: Observant, curious about discounts and Mani's activities.
Following and observing Mani's actions.
Observing the scene from a partially open doorway.
Initiates conversation with Mani, trying to understand his actions.
Observing Mani's actions with his mother.
Observing the conversation and manipulation unfold.
Receives instructions from Mani regarding the accident vehicle.
The montage implies Unni is the one visiting the police station to file the complaint.
Observing the manipulation of evidence without reaction.
Present with Mani.
Present during Mani's explanation of the process.
Present, observes the manipulation of evidence.
Present in the chamber.
Receives a bank credit notification on his mobile.
Receives a bank debit notification on his mobile while in the bathroom.
Observing Mani and Meenakshi, asking questions.
Observing Mani with growing curiosity.
Confused then enlightened by Meenakshi's explanation.
Following and observing Mani's activities.
Observing Mani from the hallway through a partially open door.
Following Mani, offers to pay for tea and asks a pointed question.
Observing the manipulation unfold.
Receiving instructions and vehicle details from Mani.
Implied, initiating the FIR process.
Observing the manipulation of evidence, unfazed.
N/A
Receiving a notification on his phone.
Receiving a notification on his phone while in the bathroom.

main_characters.name: Meenakshi
descriptions: Billing section staff, handles receipts, initially stoic, shows empathy for Unni's mother, has a PSC exam.
Hospital employee, handles receipts and discounts, shows empathy.
Hospital employee, handling receipts.
Hospital employee, explains Mani's role.

main_characters.name: Venu Vakkeel
descriptions: 40 years old, advocate, actively breaks watch and glasses to inflate claim value.
Stands up to present the case, calls witnesses.
Present during the signing.
Advocate, on speaker phone, shows interest in more severe cases.
Advocate, instructing the doctor on speaker phone to exaggerate injuries.
Presents his case and witnesses.
N/A

main_characters.name: RESHMA GEORGE (MLA)
descriptions: Sitting, receives legal documents, signs them, asks about the lawyers.

main_characters.name: GANGADHARAN (Vakkeel)
descriptions: A senior lawyer, questions Unni about the affidavit, hears out his junior, then confronts and fires Unni for interfering with the MLA's case, reacting strongly to Unni's disrespect.

main_characters.name: ROBIN
descriptions: Suggests Unni join him, orders coffee, comments on Jyothi's cases, displays a shabby appearance (worn shirt, dirty shoes), goes to meet his client.
Stands in the ATM queue, explains why he's not in court (took an acting gig for 500 INR), winks at Unni.

main_characters.name: JYOTHI
descriptions: Drinks coffee, orders more, cynically comments on her cases, expresses 'manushyatham' (humanity), and argues with Unni about the ethics of law.

main_characters.name: Unni's Amma (Jaanaki)
descriptions: Unni's mother, subject of the claim, lying in a hospital ward.
Has a hand plaster, wears a watch and spectacles.

main_characters.name: Venu Vakkeel (Advocate Venu AV)
descriptions: 40 years old, lawyer, orchestrates the intentional damage of personal items for claim.

main_characters.name: Jaanaki Amma
descriptions: Signing legal documents.
